text.text: How does the system handle accounting periods with unposted items in ZOLL Billing?

text: If there are unposted items, the system will display a red arrow next to the period's date, "Review needed" in the status column, and a "Review now" button. You can reconcile issues and then post the period, or you can click Close anyway to close the accounting period without reconciling the issues. In the latter case, the system bumps the unreconciled items from this accounting period into the next accounting period.

text.text: What does it mean if a red arrow and "Review needed" display next to an accounting period?

text: If a red arrow and "Review needed" display next to an accounting period, it means that the system cannot make an adjustment to a previously closed period. The system will assign it the next open period which is most often the same period in which you are working.

text.text: Where can I find the "Review now" button to address unposted items in an accounting period?

text: To get started, click Accounting Periods on the navigation bar. The system provides help and guidance the first time you go through the closing process. You can only close accounting periods in sequential order - always the oldest period first.

text.text: What sections are displayed on the Review Unposted Charges & Credits page?

text: The system displays three sections on the Review Unposted Charges & Credits page; unposted charges, unposted transactions, and unposted adjustment requests. All sections provide links to pages that contains details that will help you resolve the issue.

text.text: Can you explain the purpose of the unposted charges, unposted transactions, and unposted adjustment requests sections?

text: If you have an October 15th claim, as long as the October period is open the charges for that claim will go into that period. However, if you work an October 15th claim in November after the October accounting period is closed, the charges will go into the November period with an October date.

text.text: How can I resolve issues related to unposted items in an accounting period?

text: You can reconcile issues and then post the period, or you can click Close anyway to close the accounting period without reconciling the issues. In the latter case, the system bumps the unreconciled items from this accounting period into the next accounting period.

text.text: Is there an option to close the accounting period without reconciling the unposted items?

text: Yes, you can click Close anyway to close the accounting period without reconciling the issues. In the latter case, the system bumps the unreconciled items from this accounting period into the next accounting period.

text.text: What happens if I choose to close the period anyway without reconciling?

text: The system bumps the unreconciled items from this accounting period into the next accounting period.

text.text: Are there links provided on the Review Unposted Charges & Credits page to help resolve issues?

text: Yes, the system provides links to pages that contains details that will help you resolve the issue.

text.text: Can you explain the process of posting the period after reconciling the unposted items?

text: If you reconcile issues and then post the period, the system will post the period.

text.text: How many sections are displayed on the Review Unposted Charges & Credits page?

text: The system displays three sections on the Review Unposted Charges & Credits page.

text.text: Claims with unposted charges" section contains which page link?

text: The "Claims with unposted charges" section contains a link to the Claim page.
